text: Blase Joseph CupichLaurie Goodstein, "Pope Names Prelate With Inclusive Views as Chicago Archbishop," New York Times, Sept. 20, 2014. (born March 19, 1949 in Omaha, Nebraska) is an American prelate of the Catholic Church. He is serving as the ninth Archbishop of the Archdiocese of Chicago. He was the surprise choice of Pope Francis to succeed Cardinal Francis George as Archbishop of Chicago on September 20, 2014. Cupich had served as the sixth bishop of the Diocese of Spokane. In August 2024, Cupich delivered the opening invocation at the 2024 Democratic National Convention in Chicago. ==References== Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:American Roman Catholic archbishops Category:Religious leaders from Chicago Category:People from Omaha, Nebraska
title: Blase J. Cupich
